item.title: Prologue
item.description: Prologue # The Burning Church # Christmas 1905. In Aizpute, Province of Courland, Latvia, part of the Russian Empire. # There, on top of a small hill surrounded by the wheat fields of Courland, stood a gigantic Oak tree whose brown trunk and green leaves contrasted with the white-painted boards of the baptist church behind it. The Oak tree stood like a silent sentinel of the land: it had seen the times that land was filled with other Oaks like it, now it stood alone.
